Description: Klazomenian amphora of pale cream pottery. The vessel has a handle on either side of the cylindrical neck. The exterior is finished with a cream slip on which have been painted dark red bands of decoration. These consist of two close-set horizontal bands at the shoulder and another lower on the body, with two bands which begin at the rim and run down the outside of each handle, then down the body as far as the lower horizontal band. The side of the jar is perforated by ten drill-holes, made post-production, at the level of the shoulder.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 300)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.95, p.112-113, p.129, p.202, pl.44)
Exhibition history: 2016, 19 May-27 Nov, BM exhibition Sunken Treasures
